Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: traveling with my husband on business so I stayed in the room all day for 2 days. Service by the staff was poor, our room got skipped by housekeeping the first day and had to call the front desk for clean towels and to have the trash emptied. Then we had to kill several cockroaches which is not a pleasant task for me. The management did give us a discounted rate for both nights, but housekeeping is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive average hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul l
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta is an inexpensive hotel. The rooms are utilitarian. Bathrooms are functional, beds are OK, wifi is reasonable speed, TVs are new with 35 HD channels, outdoor pool, small lobby, no bar. If you are looking for a place to sleep without a lot of frills... This could be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay outside of the city. We will definitely stay again. We have stayed at LaQuinta several times in the past month. I think this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Jorman85
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Clean, great location and friendly staff. If you are looking for a resort don't stay here if you want a nice place at a great price stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: poca1313
Reviews.Content: This wasn't the fanciest hotel but it wasn't the worst but for the discount price we got was were highly satisfied. Staff were very friendly, breakfast was great (more then just bread items), room was clean and beds were comfortable. Room had a slight smell when you first walked in but nothing you couldn't get over, and the entrance to the hotel is a little hard to find. But there is 2 shopping plazas right across the street and another one less then 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Staying with the best”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelmina R
Reviews.Content: Stinky: Shi-Tzu I have stayed at the Laquinta several days a month for the past 6 months. While it is not a 5 star hotel. The staff treats you like you are in @ a 5 star. The staff have the over all additude that what ever needs to be done. its there responsibility to do it. ASAP, from the Manager / Front desk clerks / Housekeeping to Maintance/ Eng. The Very Best Staff, not even the Hyatt can top them.The Beds very comfortable. The facility and grounds very clean.TV could use some help ,that is with the Channels. Tom Tom gps will direct you to the front door. Improvements; Automatic doors for the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Iffy Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Suziewrite
Reviews.Content: This is one of the older La Quintas on the East Coast, and the neighborhood is definitely so-so. That said, the front desk staff was terrific and friendly, the room was very clean, with comfy beds and decent linens, and a new TV. The hotel has the usual LaQ breakfast with two waffle machines. I was in town for a cat show, and this was the show hotel, so they're definitely pet friendly. I got a phenomenal price via bid at Priceline, and was pleased to get a n.s. room with two beds. The one major drawback was that the entrance to the hotel was NOT well marked; both my husband and I (traveling in separate cars) got lost. I'd even called beforehand, but the desk clerk was not the person who'd given me the directions. BTW, I'd had a package shipped, and it was waiting for me at the front desk. Not one of La Quinta's stellar properties, but the price was good, the value was there, and I felt safe the entire time I was there. Incidentally, the desk clerk directed us to a fabulous local seafood restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t Waste your MONEY”
Reviews.Author: KaRhonda G
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was totally not worth it.On the second day here, our room was still not cleaned by 3pm.When I asked the question of what time are the rooms cleaned, the front desk clerk responded with, "when they get to them". When the lady finally got to our room to clean it, she did it so fast that she could not have done a thorough job. Then her cell phone rings and she held a conversation the entire time she was in our room (cleaning). Never will stay here again. Totally UNPROFESSIONAL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stop over hotel stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mai-ImIt
Reviews.Content: It's okay if you are stopping for the night. The room is clean and excitingly colorful. The beds are comfy. You won't find anymore amenities in this hotel but the breakfast is defintely a bonus. Elevator is old and looks unsanitary. This hotel is functional for an overnight stay, otherwise, would you live here for a long time? I say keep on driving to your final destination.

Reviews.Title: “at least they have a shuttle”
Reviews.Author: allyxandria
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living so of course I've seen my share of hotels. Check in at the LaQuinta went ok, however when I got to my room, the counter and ice bin had cigarette burns on it as if someone used it for an ashtray. I had to use the laundry bag to put ice in because there was no ice bag in the ice bin...then the ice machine on my floor didn't work so i had to go down to the 1st floor just to get ice..The iron didn't work, and there was a stain on my bed.....i say stay elsewhere if possible

Reviews.Title: “Had a spider in my room!”
Reviews.Author: Seetraveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fine, the front desk was helpful and checked us in promptly. The elevator floors could've used some good cleaning and the halls are a bit dingy. Got into the room and was cold, so turned on the heater. The units are under the window and the window had a curtain, so when the warm air was blowing out - the air would blow into the curtain, which in turn would not circulate in the room. So, in order to get the room warmer had to crank up the heater. And that's when I saw the spider on the curtain! I first thought it was dead so didn't touch it. Then afterwards when I was sitting on my bed - I saw it moving onto the ceiling and then the wall!! Ended up killing it with my slipper! Didn't want to move room as we had already showered and were comfortable in bed. The room was shabby with an outdated tv. Bathrooms were not clean at all. Toilet didn't look like it was cleaned so couldn't really sit on it and the shower wasn't clean either. They should really look into what their housekeeping does. Seems to me that they pay housekeeping to do nothing at all. Breakfast wasn't bad - but it shuts down around 9am! So better wake up early to eat. Choices were good and the area was clean. The hotel is located off the freeway and that was the best part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly-Halifax
Reviews.Content: Travelling from Nova Scotia. Was picked up at the airport - although the pickup could have been sooner - waited about an hour. Arrived at the hotel, where we received excellent service, room was good. The staff were very helpful in getting us to the light train so we could visit the waterfront. They then pickup us at the light train and drive us back to the hotel. The breakfast in the morning was good. The staff then arranged for us to be driving to the ship were we are going to take a Cruise. Wonderful front desk staff and Assistant Manager.

Reviews.Title: “Another good La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: LarrySTexas
Reviews.Content: For a comfortable night I have never been disappointed by La Quinta and after a day of air travel, some driving and sightseeing, was glad to have such a place waiting so as to unwind. Only complaint was that at exactly 9 a.m. EDT, they shut down breakfast while I had a waffle grilling, and made to feel hurried. Just arriving from the Central Time Zone and sleeping in after a hard day, felt they could have left their good breakfast up a bit longer for summer vacation travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Super Clean Room - Friendly Staff - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: dilansmom
Reviews.Content: Was concerned about my stay after reading some of the earlier reviews but all was excellent. The desk staff was super friendly and helpful. Our room was soooo clean. Even the bathroom grout was fresh and white. I was very impressed. The only thing that was lacking was a refrigerator and microwave in the room. As for the previous review about being in a bad part of town - no. There are a ton of shopping centers all around and everything was well maintained. There is a security guard on duty at night but, it is Baltimore!! It's not like Cleveland where you can't even get into or out of your elevator without swiping your key card. We were out until about 3:30 am to a concert and eats with a friend and even at that time in the morning all was quiet and the parking lot was well lit. I look forward to staying at this location again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, quiet, clean with courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jsurprise68
Reviews.Content: The staff on duty was very courteous and polite. We stayed for two days and the room was adequate enough to fit our needs. We had 2 double beds. There is no refrigerator or microwave but they do have and iron/w board. Also there is a TV in the room. The location of the Inn was fine. Right across the street is McD/Walmart/Home Depot just to name a few. A little further out there are many other restaurants and POI. We had our GPS systems and was able to travel outside of the area with no problem. We liked the cleanliness of the rooms. The bathroom was large enough but not oversize. This was a two day stay. If I had to stay longer I would probably stay in a nicer hotel. They do serve breakfast but we do not have breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff...hotel is not great but not horrible”
Reviews.Author: QuietWater
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much but if you are looking to stay in the Essex area you already know there is not much to choose from. The hotel was better than I expected. The staff was the outstanding part of the stay. They responded promptly and courteously to all questions and requests. Everytime I saw any staff members in the hall they smiled and said hello. The check in was quick and pleasant, the hotel is in a business park so navigating in was a little difficult at night. The hotel was clean, the rooms were VERY basic but also clean. We stayed in a king room, bed was fine, TV worked, plenty of towels, shampoo and soap only, bathroom could use a face lift. The carpet, towels and linens looked fairly new. The room had a small recliner which was kind of a funny, neat thing. The room was surprisingly quiet as we were right across from the elevator. Breakfast was fine, hard boiled eggs, cereal, juice, toast, bagels, waffles, etc. The fitness center is only slightly larger than a closet but has three machines crammed in there. I wouldn't stay here for pleasure but since it was a work thing only it was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “I was not satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: rabrol6
Reviews.Content: When calling the front desk about a question before the trip was not satisfying, didn't know how to answer my question or find my reservation. The room was very small. There was no fridge or microwave. I've never stayed in a hotel that didn't have a fridge. There was only one elevator and it was really slow. The location was good, but hard to find with my gps.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: mohdsurgery
Reviews.Content: I went there because it is only 7 miles away from Hopkins, but with the trafic it did not make any difference. If I have to go back again, I would rather pay extra 20 dollars and stay in a nicer hotel. Heat did not work well of systematic problem that they have as they said "it only works if there is motion", I was freezing in bed. There was some bad smell in the hallway. Bathroon is small and narrow. Trash cans did not have trash bags. Nonetheless, staff was helpful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate. . . Nice Staff. . . Bad neighborhood. . . Stay elsewhere if possible. . .”
Reviews.Author: JamesStock
Reviews.Content: I probably said it all in my title. We stayed overnight here on our way to DC. They only had the "Smoking Floor" available. (I didn't even know there was still such a thing.) Needless to say, the floor and room smelled disgusting. . . There is a night guard on duty as the neighborhood is so bad. The staff is very nice. And the room was clean if sparse. But those are the only two positive things i can say about this particular hotel. If at all possible, i would recommend staying elsewhere. The hotels in nearby White Marsh (near the shopping center) seemed a LOT nicer (but were full the night we needed a room).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: LincolnVet
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay immensely. Seems a couple YEARS after bad reviews were left the La Quinta cleaned up they're act. The hotel is NOT in a bad area. Other hotels, newer homes and airport parking are next to it. The other hotels in the area were about $30 more per night so we got a bargain. If you want to nitpick the driveway is hard to see, but after you pull in once you figure it out. The lobby was always busy, but isn't that good?!? The hotel looks like it had been recently renovated. The room was very clean, no complaints at all! The free breakfast was also a huge plus, much more than the standard doughnut and coffee, we enjoyed fresh waffles, fruit and eggs. The pool was nice, and had a lifeguard, (outdoor pool). We would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: StarAZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was Okay at best. Fairly clean and somewhat pleasant staff. Booked two rooms through Priceline and then called the hotel to ask that the rooms were close to each other or at least on the same floor. I was told that there is only one room per floor that it designated as 'Priceline rooms' . Therefore, the rooms would not be on same floor. When we arrived at the hotel noticed several people just hanging around in the lobby and outside that appeared to be from the drug treatment facility behind the hotel. This was the case regardless of the time of day. The hotel does provide breakfast but we needed to ask that items be replenished both days. Most people staying here were appeared to be on business, but the others that just 'hung' around were scary. The hotel does provide a security guard in the evening, but I am not sure how often he leaves the lobby. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff; Everything else very adequate”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4Adventure
Reviews.Content: First of all, I received the discount offered by the hotel to Johns Hopkins patients, which helped substantially. I only wish I'd known about it before I stayed four nights in Baltimore two weeks ago; I could have saved about $200! Yes, it was difficult to find the entrance to the parking lot, and yes, it was necessary to locate a tiny sign at ground level and then figure out how to get over to the hotel. Though the hotel itself is visible from the interstate, it is accessible only through parking lots of other businesses--not an ideal situation when one is tired and it's after dark. Upon entering the lobby with its small seating area, I noticed a couple or three people sittting around, and I wondered how come they seemed to be sitting there watching people check in. However, that didn't seem to present any problem. I was very happy to find that the juice machine used at breakfast had been left on, and I had a couple of cups of cranberry juice before going to my room--much better than soda. The clerk was efficient, and check-in was uneventful. I had asked for a ground-floor room with two beds. That's exactly what I got. Everything was clean and in working order; the beds were confortable. Noise was not a problem. I must caution anyone wishing to venture into the surrounding area after dark, however. I needed to go to the nearby WalMart not far from the hotel, and I felt definitely uneasy in that store. That WalMart had trash in the parking area; the store seemed poorly kept, and people seemed to be wandering in and out. I was glad to leave it and return to the hotel. At breakfasat the next day, a very solicitous lady made me a waffle herself and delivered it to my table. She was glad to find the cups for me, and then asked if she could do anything else. Her attitude was very upbeat, her interactions with the other staff very heartwarming, and I felt that it was just like home. Driving into the city that day was easy; staff provided good directions--better than MapQuest--and I felt that overall, I had gotten a very good value. Suggestion: if you're traveling alone, you would probably want to get to the hotel before dark and then stay put.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Conditions at Entrance”
Reviews.Author: Scion
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairfield Inn North Baltimore was ruined by a harrowing experience upon arrival. As we approached the hotel around 10:00 p.m., we saw the very tall Fairfield sign in the distance. As we approached the sign, we discovered that there was no driveway to enter there. We had missed the narrow, unlighted, and unmarked driveway some distance behind us. We were on a four-lane divided highway, so there was no way to back up to the entance, even if we had seen it. So I tried to turn at the next intersection, thinking that the entrance might be on the side of the property. The turn put me onto the on ramp of an Interstate highway! Not wanting to drive four or five miles to the next exit to turn around, I stopped and backed up a few feet and found myself in the middle of a busy intersection with cars whizzing by and turning in all directions. It was very scary, and I finally had to drive through the intersection against the light just to get out of everyone's way. Sure, I could have driven down the ramp, but the point is, the Fairfield Inn should not have created this situation for me. When I asked the desk clerk about this problem, he said three or four people miss the entrance every day. Then he gave a lengthy explanation of other property owners adjacent, etc. He was polite but offered no assurance that the problem would be addressed. He seemed rather resigned to the fact that it would not. So, if you are going to stay at this hotel, approach carefully and look for a narrow driveway that appears to lead you into the parking lot of the adjacent business but then extends to the Fairfield Inn lot. I informed the Marriott Company of this situation and hope they will correct it before someone is serious hurt. All I got out of the stay was a dent in my bumper, and, oh, a day-old donut for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Converted Susse Chalet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBunny271
Reviews.Content: Hotel is next to a drug rehab halfway house with a Section 8 apartment complex behind it. Need I say more? Once was a Susse Chalet hotel, part of a chain of very well-managed hotels. Not any more.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Gussie06
Reviews.Content: I would not say it was the worst hotel that I ever stayed at but it was definitely not the best. I agree with the one reviewer, it was not a great neigborhood, but better then inner Baltimore itself. Baltimore is a scary scary place. Make sure you have good directions when traveling around. The hotel was okay. The toilet in our room was broken the second we got there. There was a leak from the room above us so the bathroom ceiling was damaged. The tubs were slippery providing no skid resistance, which is very dangerous to children as well as adults. The light in the bathroom was minimal and the shower curtain blocked it out completely making the shower seem dark and claustrophobic. The towels were threadbare. The pool is away from the hotel and is very small. It goes from three foot to six foot and its really not long enough to make that transition smoothly. It is however in a gated area. The staff was courteous and efficient. I was glad though that we were only there for a one night stay. Avoid this place is possible.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel all over and stay in Fairfield Inn's 99% of the time. Breakfast was great! Room was clean! Staff was awesome! This hotel has by far the best and most compassionate staff I have ever encountered. Just outside of Baltimore, it was close enough for convenience yet far enough to avoid the city chaos. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Oh My, Get out of the Way!”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: Stay far far away! We had a room booked for $89, when I called national Marriott to confirm the rate the night before, somebody had overriden the rate to $179. National Marriott didnt even understand how the rate was so high and they changed it. This should of been a sign not to stay here. We had just visited a local University, and arrived at the hotel. We didnt even walk in the front door, let alone the parking lot. It is an awful area, by far one of the worst areas I have ever seen. There are bums on the street and people just hanging out on the streets. There is low income housing right across the way from the hotel. My advice; for safety, pick somewhere else, we did the Hampton Inn White Marsh and what a great place.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Baltimore North
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Philadelphia Court, Baltimore, MD 21237 (Formerly Fairfield Inn)
